Key Arguments: Concerns about who decides what content is false, misleading, or deceptive.
Examples from the Covid-19 pandemic where government decisions on misinformation were later proven incorrect.
Broad definitions of harm and who determines what constitutes harm.
Opposition to government exclusion from accountability for misleading content.
Belief that the legislation infringes on free expression rights.
Notable Quotes: I am totally against this legislation as I believe that it infringes on the rights of all Australian citizens to be able to express their opinions on social media platforms.
Who or what body will be the one deciding whether or not content is false?
They should NOT be excluded from being held accountable especially given that they were some of the main contributors to misleading information during the Covid-19 pandemic.
